intro: Tradescantia nuevoleonensis, commonly known as the Nuevo León spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or as a houseplant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological significance in its native habitat.
